document_data.name: Oathbreaker Knight
document_data.mainbody:
The '''Oathbreaker Knight''' was a supernatural figure who appeared before those [[paladin]]s of the Realms who tarnished, broke, or even completely abandoned the [[Paladin#Paladin Oaths|oaths]] they made in life. He was once a mortal knight himself, before he was called to greater service.

{{Quote|I wielded the powers of darkness, yet held a candle for those who needed the light...Good or ill, I made my choices. Eventually, I heard the call of others who had strayed. I showed them the way, as I show you now.|Oathbreaker Knight.}}
document_data.Description:
The Oathbreaker Knight wore a set of filgreed [[full plate]] armor, that featured interlocking, spiked plates and claw-like gauntlets. A blood-red cape was draped over his shoulders.

The knight's body—if even one still existed—was entirely shrouded by his armor. The eye slits in his helm revealed no portion of his face, rather fiery orange light and green smoke that radiated outward from within.
document_data.Personality: He was a stoic figure that did not necessarily judge the paladins before whom he presented himself. He remained objective in his dealings, merely noting misdeeds and crimes that were committed, along with their corresponding consequences.
document_data.Abilities: The Oathbreaker Knight was a fearsome combatant, one that possessed tremendous strength and undeniable charisma. When appearing before a mortal, he could grow to nearly twice his size, and conjure darkness and ethereal flames upon his body at will.
document_data.Activities:
{{Quote|When another's oath is broken, I stand witness. I hear their sorrow. I see their jubilation. I guide their hand.|The knight, on other paladins.}}

At times, paladins strayed from their divine purpose, whether to uphold righteous justice or defend the natural world. It was on those occasions the Oathbreaker Knight would appear. The knight would offer them a choice: repent and make right their transgression, or embrace the [[oathbreaker|path of darkness]]. For those paladins that erred in judgement but wished to keep true to their oaths, the Oathbreaker Knight could reforge their oaths. For paladins who broke their oath for the first time, the Oathbreaker Knight charged a fee of 1,000 gold pieces to reforge the oath. If the oath was broken a second time, the fee rose to 2,000 gold pieces.
